meanings.definition: To come together to form one group or mass.
meanings.sent1: The students coalesce in the cafeteria during lunchtime.
meanings.sent2: The different colors coalesce to create a beautiful rainbow.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the recipe coalesce to make a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The voices of the choir coalesce into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces slowly coalesce into a complete picture.

meanings.definition: To unite or merge into a whole.
meanings.sent1: The two rival groups coalesce to form a stronger team.
meanings.sent2: The rivers coalesce into a large lake.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish coalesce to create a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The ideas in the meeting coalesce into a comprehensive plan.
meanings.sent5: The scattered clouds coalesce into a dark storm.
